description: {"blocks":[{"key":"f8njl","text":"This is the instructor protocol for","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2n7ad","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8uh36","text":"It contains setup instructions and instructor tips for running the lab.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":67176,"title":"Dilutions and Pipetting Practice","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eDilutions and Pipetting Practice\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"dilutions-and-pipetting-practice-cdugs6tw","image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ik78bvh6p.jpg","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ik78bvh6p.jpg","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Brian Teague","affiliation":"University of Wisconsin - Stout","affiliation_url":"teagueb@uwstout.edu","username":"brian-teague1","link":"https://teague.bio","image":{"source":"/img/avatars/012.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/012.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":12},"type_id":1,"guid":"E25C2C300C2811EDBAA963A4AB41B0AC"}}}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"bibnu","text":"Grocery store food coloring - red, green, blue, yellow","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acr8r","text":"(4) 15 ml conicals","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4uh7","text":"microcentrifuge tubes - (4) for each set.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpgvs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mrh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"v9ur","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8688h","text":"I usually ask two student groups to share a set of reagents.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ej9mc","text":"In the conical tubes, add 500 µl of food coloring to 9.5 ml of tap water to make the \"10X stocks.\" Make a stock for each color.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c0aki","text":"Transfer  of each stock into a microcentrifuge tubes. Label them appropriately.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ddo3m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"0CECAAF00C2A11EDBAA963A4AB41B0AC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"tcak","text":"Instructor Tips","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"178j2","text":"I often start the class by having students grab a P-1000 or P-200, setting them to 500 and 200 µl respectively, and together slowly pressing down to find the first stop, then the second. We transfer a bit of water together, then I leave them to their own.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b088u","text":"Students often recognize c1 * v1 = c2 * v2 but have never actually used it (or have forgotten how to use it) to actually make dilutions. The original protocol, from which this was adapted, has quite explicit instructions. I usually allow students to struggle, ask them to consult their colleagues, etc, and then when a group is properly stuck will help them through it.   ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cdfho","text":"Stand by the standards and compare students' results with them. Students often don't have a good idea of how close is \"close enough.\" Both the volumes and colors should be precisely the same!","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5opr","text":"Comparing students' samples to standards is easier if you set the standards on a piece of white paper.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3n06","text":"If a student's sample is substantially different, ask them to go back and try it again. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5k9om","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2d1qq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"25eda","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"96su8","text":"If, after a second attempt, a student sample isn't correct, follow them back to their bench and observe their technique closely. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbc39","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8r67d","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a7d51","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3ii45","text":"This is a good place to begin normalizing failure and multiple attempts.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7pvnv","text":"It's better to catch technique errors here than later, after a bunch of failed PCRs!","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4c2gc","text":"Common student errors","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7f3t7","text":"Pressing the plunger all the way down (instead of to the first top) when aspirating, and thus aspirating too much liquid.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4lgv3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3sa3r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3jj5t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5t9aq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kveq","text":"Not watching their pipetting, but doing so blind (especially for the 1/10th scale).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"au0r9","text":"Making their \"mixed\" samples from the 10X concentrate instead of the 1X working stocks.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dlsbm","text":"Forgetting that to make a dilution, they need to add both the concentrate and a diluent (in this case, water).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2q62l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"db3do","text":"This is BY FAR the most common technique error.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

title: Dilutions and Pipetting Practice (Instructor Protocol)
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"4ognj","text":"Food coloring can stain skin and clothing. Use appropriate PPE, including a lab coat and gloves.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
